- arrow\_backExtended Diagnostics

  - [NG8101: Invalid Banana-in-Box](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/NG8101)
  - [NG8102: Nullish coalescing not nullable](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/NG8102)
  - [NG8103: Missing control flow directive](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/NG8103)
  - [NG8104: Text attribute not binding](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/NG8104)
  - [NG8105: Missing \`let\` keyword in an \`\*ngFor\` expression](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/NG8105)
  - [NG8106: Suffix not supported](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/NG8106)
  - [NG8107: Optional chain not nullable](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/NG8107)
  - [NG8108: \`ngSkipHydration\` should be a static attribute](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/NG8108)

This site uses cookies from Google to deliver its services and to analyze traffic.

[Learn more](https://policies.google.com/technologies/cookies) Ok, Got it

This diagnostic detects a backwards "banana-in-box" syntax for [two-way bindings](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/guide/templates/two-way-binding).

```
      <user-viewer ([user])="loggedInUser" />

```

check

## [What's wrong with that?](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/NG8101\#whats-wrong-with-that)

As it stands, `([var])` is actually an [event binding](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/guide/templates/event-listeners) with the name `[var]`.
The author likely intended this as a two-way binding to a variable named `var` but, as written, this binding has no effect.

## [What should I do instead?](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/NG8101\#what-should-i-do-instead)

Fix the typo.
As the name suggests, the banana `(` should go _inside_ the box `[]`.
In this case:

```
      <user-viewer [(user)]="loggedInUser" />

```

check

## [Configuration requirements](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/NG8101\#configuration-requirements)

[`strictTemplates`](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/tools/cli/template-typecheck#strict-mode) must be enabled for any extended diagnostic to emit.
`invalidBananaInBox` has no additional requirements beyond `strictTemplates`.

## [What if I can't avoid this?](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/NG8101\#what-if-i-cant-avoid-this)

This diagnostic can be disabled by editing the project's `tsconfig.json` file:

```
      {  "angularCompilerOptions": {    "extendedDiagnostics": {      "checks": {        "invalidBananaInBox": "suppress"      }    }  }}

```

check

See [extended diagnostic configuration](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/extended-diagnostics#configuration) for more info.
